definitions.text: the act of traveling by foot
examples: walking is a healthy form of exercise

definitions.text: (baseball) an advance to first base by a batter who receives four balls
examples: he worked the pitcher for a base on balls
he had a funny walk
he took a walk after lunch

definitions.text: a path set aside for walking
examples: after the blizzard he shoveled the front walk

definitions.text: a slow gait of a horse in which two feet are always on the ground

examples: it happens in all walks of life

definitions.text: use one's feet to advance; advance by steps
examples: Walk, don't run!
We walked instead of driving
She walks with a slight limp
The patient cannot walk yet
Walk over to the cabinet
I'll walk you to your car
Walk the tightrope
Paul walked the streets of Damascus
She walks 3 miles every day

definitions.text: give a base on balls to
live or behave in a specified manner
examples: walk in sadness

definitions.text: be or act in association with
examples: We must walk with our dispossessed brothers and sisters
Walk with God
The horses walked across the meadow
He walks the horse up the mountain
Walk the dog twice a day

definitions.text: take a walk; go for a walk; walk for pleasure
examples: The lovers held hands while walking
We like to walk every Sunday
